headline: AMD spends $1.6 billion to keep 1,200 engineers in Nvidia fight
summary: Investing.com -- AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) has finalized a deal to divest the manufacturing segment of ZT Systems, selling it to Sanmina Corporation (NASDAQ:SANM) for $3 billion. The transaction, announced on May 19, includes $2.55 billion in cash and stock, along with up to $450 million in potential earnouts over the next three years.

headline: Advanced Micro Devices (NasdaqGS:AMD) Engages In Merger Talks With Sanmina Corporation
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (NasdaqGS:AMD) recently held an M&A call with Sanmina Corporation, signaling a potential shift in growth strategy. Over the past month, AMD's stock price surged 31%, a change that is significantly larger than the market's 1.6% increase. Key factors likely contributing to this performance include robust Q1 2025 earnings growth and an expanded share buyback plan. The announced strategic alliances and product launches further underscore AMD's comprehensive approach to...
